defect.para: The vehicles involved are AmTran RE model school buses built from May 1, 1995 through March 15, 1996.

The rear window buzzer switch does not comply with the requirements set forth in Federal Motor Vehicle Safety Standard (FMVSS) 217. FMVSS 217 requires the rear window buzzer to be activated when the latch is not in the closed and locked position. The current rear window buzzer switch works independently from the latching mechanism and will activate the buzzer only if the window is not in the closed position. If the window is closed but the latch is not in the locked position, the buzzer will not be activated and the driver will not be alerted that the rear window is unlatched.

svcprocinfo.para: The current mechanical rear window buzzer switch must be replaced with a proximity type switch (refer to Figure 1, Figure 2, and Figure 3).

svcsubproc.title: Switch Sensor Installation
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 2 for the following steps.

step1.para: Remove existing buzzer switch from window frame.
Cut and remove foam seal in area of new switch.
Locate and drill (2) 3/32 inch holes per Detail A. New switch is to be located as close to window frame vertical edge as possible.
Switch sensor requires counter sinking holes in top prior to installing screws.
Attach ring terminal to white wire and ground to window frame per Detail A.
Connection of black wire requires removal of window to gain access under window frame. Wire splice must be routed through rubber grommet and hidden under frame.

svcsubproc.para: *Wire splice can be made by pulling bottom of window out approximately 2 to 3 inches.

svcsubproc.title: Magnetic Actuator Installation
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 3 for the following steps.

step1.para: Mark window slide for magnetic actuator using notch as reference for hole location. Actuator is located flush to the outside edge of window slide. Interference between sensor and magnet may occur if located incorrectly.
Drill (2) 3/32 inch holes in window slide. Do not install until vertical edge is cut away per Detail B.
Use die grinder to remove vertical edge of window (see cutout detail).
Install magnet to slide with #4 screws (Item 3). Pull slide out away from window and use grinder to cut screw threads flush with bottom of slide (see detail).
Magnet must be centered on actuator within .25 inch for switch to operate correctly.
Check all connections. Turn ignition key on. Pull window release handle. Buzzer should sound. If not, check all wiring connections to switch.

entry.para: Remove and replace rear window latch

responuscan.para:
Proceed immediately to make necessary correction to units in inventory. As a precaution, you should not operate any of the vehicles subject to this recall campaign until they have been inspected for the presence of the nut assembled to the pinch bolt. In the event that the nut is missing, repairs must be made before the vehicle is driven. All inventory vehicles subject to this recall campaign must be corrected prior to sale, transfer or delivery.
If vehicles have been sold or transferred and you are in receipt of Customer Notification Letters and Authorization for Recall Service cards for those vehicles, transfer location or customer must be notified from your dealer location.

The National Traffic and Motor Vehicle Safety Act, as amended, provides that each vehicle that is subject to a vehicle recall campaign must be adequately repaired within a reasonable time after the owner has tendered it for repair. A failure to adequately repair within 60 days after a tender of a vehicle is prima facie evidence of failure to repair within a reasonable time. If the condition is not adequately repaired within 60 days, the owner may be entitled to replacement with an identical or reasonable equivalent vehicle at no charge, or to a refund of the purchase price less a reasonable allowance for depreciation.

In order to avoid having to replace an owner's vehicle or refund the purchase price, every effort must be made to promptly schedule an appointment with each owner to repair his or her vehicle as soon as possible.
